item.title: Loop analysis
item.description: Loop analysis It’s important to remember that the time complexity, and in particular the big O notation is an aproximation and it is supposed to represents only the growth in relation of a variable input. It’s not the sum of the time taken by each algorithm step, it’s a measurement of the computation time growth for an arbitrary, variable input. Anything constant can be ignored O(1) Represent the time complexity of an algorithms which doesn’t perform any loop, recursion, or call to a non time-costant function
